title: Formative Practice for the FRQ 3 - Non-syllabus Part B

content.question: Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words. In the passage, Eutropius presents Trajan as an emperor who is particularly selfless. In 2 to 3 complete sentences, provide at least one Latin citation from lines 4-9 (nullum...agens) that supports this interpretation. Explain how the Latin citation(s) support(s) the interpretation. In your response you should do the following: Include at least one specific Latin citation from the passage. Provide the Latin and/or cite line numbers and translate or accurately paraphrase the Latin. Refer to more than a single word in your reference. Explain how the Latin citation(s) support(s) your response.

Provide the Latin and/or cite line numbers and translate or accurately paraphrase the Latin. Refer to more than a single word in your reference. Explain how the Latin citation(s) support(s) your response.

skill.text: 3.B: Explain how specific evidence supports an interpretation of a Latin text.
